body_html:
@kmitchner : right, same for me, "P2" seems to be normal, and I apparently didn't pay attention to it beforehand.

It seems the problem has to do with cuDNN. At least I now have a version running tf 0.8, CUDA 7.5 and cuDNN 2.0 (not sure if that's even supported, but at least it's working again). It's really very strange since that can't be a rare configuration (Linux, TITAN X, CUDA 7.5, cuDNN 4) so either I must have done something wrong or there is a subtle compatibility issue/bug with any of the involved software (NVIDIA driver, cuDNN, CUDA, tensorflow).

body:
@kmitchner : right, same for me, "P2" seems to be normal, and I apparently didn't pay attention to it beforehand. 

It seems the problem has to do with cuDNN. At least I now have a version running tf 0.8, CUDA 7.5 and cuDNN 2.0 (not sure if that's even supported, but at least it's working again). It's really very strange since that can't be a rare configuration (Linux, TITAN X, CUDA 7.5, cuDNN 4) so either I must have done something wrong or there is a subtle compatibility issue/bug with any of the involved software (NVIDIA driver, cuDNN, CUDA, tensorflow).
